pageContext.claim: “And you don't see all those stories about the rates going through the roof anymore because we know what we're doing. At the same time, we want to get you really fantastic healthcare.”
pageContext.analysis: Health care costs continue to rise under the Trump administration, but the Affordable Care Act helped slow the rate of increase. In the early years of Trump’s presidency, many of the exchanges were destabilized by uncertainty to whether or not the law would survive. That drove insurers out of the marketplace raising costs.
